so_36074541: ... inputfile > /tmp/tmp$$ && mv /tmp/tmp$$ inputfile

grep "ERROR" error | grep -v "Login errors" > /tmp/tmp$$ && mv /tmp/tmp$$ error

so_8656525: # strip path, if any
fname="${JPEGFILE##*/}"
[ -f "$DIRNAME/$fname" ] && {
    n=1
    while [ -f "$DIRNAME/${fname%.*}_COPY${n}.${fname##*.}" ] ; do
        let n+=1
    done
    mv "$JPEGFILE" "$DIRNAME/${fname%.*}_COPY${n}.${fname##*.}"
} || mv "$JPEGFILE" "$DIRNAME"

Explanations about Options.-p: Preserves modification times, access times, and modes from the original file.
Explanations about Options.-r:
Recursively copy entire directories. Note that scp follows symbolic links
 encountered in the tree traversal.
Explanations about Options.-P:
Specifies the port to connect to on the remote host. Note that this option is
 written with a capital ‘P’, because -p is already reserved for preserving the times
 and modes of the file.

so_54415036: cd /tmp/school
rm student/*
for file in subject/*;do
    subj=${file##*/}
    while read student note ;do
        echo >>student/${student,,} ${subj^} $note
    done < $file
done
